result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan C Duran

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Juan C Duran in court.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Juan C Duran.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DEFENDANTS DEMAND FOR DISCOVERY AND INSPECTION
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan C Duran in court. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
